subject: Negotiation
title: Monochronic vs. Polychronic Time
description: Learn Monochronic vs. Polychronic Time in one minute.

hook.text: You arrive in Brazil five minutes early for a meeting. The other side arrives forty minutes late. Neither is wrong.

buildup.text: Monochronic cultures (US, UK, Germany) treat time as linear ‚Äî schedules are sacred and lateness is disrespectful.

discovery.text: Polychronic cultures (Latin America, Middle East) treat time as fluid ‚Äî relationships matter more than clocks.

twist.text: Insisting on strict schedules in a polychronic culture signals that you value the clock more than the relationship.

climax.text: Adapt to the culture's time orientation. Patience is a negotiation skill, not a weakness.

punchline.text: Time is money in some cultures. In others, relationships are.

quiz.question: What do polychronic cultures prioritize over strict schedules?
